content.description: Start standing using the large ledge just over the low roof for hands. Use holds on this ledge to mantle to a rather compromising position. Finish by topping out straight up from this position.
content.protection: Has a decently bad landing. Should probably have a couple pads.
content.location: On the boulder to the left of the route, Allusionist. This problem is on the right side of the river (downhill) facing face.

content.description: Sit start on the slopey low jug just right of the obvious right facing flake.  Move left onto the chalky sloper just right of the obvious flake or just throw straight up into the flake just above the start hold and then up through the juggy flake system to a relaxed top-out on slopers (watch out for moss).
content.location: Around the corner from allusionist on the northern boulder of the death block area.

content.description:
On the left side of the arete start standing with a hand on the arete and one on the giant pocket sidepull. Follow the arete on the right and the flake that comes out of the pocket sidepull. Move up from these holds to a good ledge and from there to spooky but solid jugs to the top out.

This route is route #6 on Boulder 2 in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook
content.protection: The moves can be a bit unusual and it’s a highball. You should probably have at least a pad and a spotter.
content.location: Just on the left side of the arete that's left of Chode and right of Death Block V2.0

content.description: Sit start on small left hand crimp, right hand sidepull. Find feet and go up!
content.location: On the same block as the Allusionist, but in the middle of the long, short, overhanging face. Just uphill from France.

content.description:
Start standing using  a sloping jug and a sidepull for hands under the right side of the face. Move out through pocket to the crack and continue climbing up the prow through the crack and pockets to the top out. The detached block under you is on for this route.

This route is #8a on Boulder 3: The Allusionist Block in the Death Block Area in the Brayack ad Keenan Falcon Guidebook.
content.location: Opposite the Allusionist Route there is a diagonally oriented boulder with several routes on it. This route starts under the roof on the right side of the boulder left of the crack system and right of the 3rd large pocket on the boulder.

content.description:
Despite the name this route isn’t bad. Stand start on 2 opposing side pulls that make up opposite facing cracks. Follow the crack to the top of the rock and throw your legs around the side to top out.

This route is #15a on Boulder 3: The Allusionist Block in the Death Block Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: In the middle of the face that is directly opposite the problem, The Allusionist. The face around the arete that is to the right of the face with Proana and France. Distinguished by the 2 cracks that come together to look like an upside down “y”.

content.description:
This route seems to deserve the name given to its supposed “variation”. Start standing with hands on a pocket and a slopey edge to the right of the pocket (the undercling that was previously used to start on in conjunction with the pocket seems to have broken). Slap up with hands just right of the arete to a crack and make an easy top out over the prow of the arete.

This route is #15 on Boulder 3: The Allusionist Block in the Death Block Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.protection: You are between 2 rocks for this route so don’t fall backwards.
content.location: The arete to the right of Given to Suck. Look for the pocket beside the arete on the left. There is a rock to your back. Your body stays on the left side of the arete for the whole route.

content.description:
Sit start on a left facing flake jug and a high right edge.  Make a long move up to the mega jug, then follow more (often mossy) jugs through a simple top out.  Ascend the mossy slab for an easy walk off on the opposite side of the boulder.

This is route # 12 on Boulder 3: The Allusionist Block in the Brayack & Keenan Guidebook.
content.location: Follows the left facing flake near the middle of the face

content.description: Only a couple moves but still fun. Start sitting with a left facing flake for hands and make a long move right to the right facing flake. Make another long move left and up to a good jug and then do an interesting top out using sloping rails and a high foot.
content.location: Just to the left of Proana and around the corner from allusionist

content.description:
Start standing with hands on a sharp right sidepull and a small left hand undercling. Find your feet and move up through a pocket and sharp edges on the featured face to the giant hollow ledge. Figure out your plan of attack and go straight up to the top out.

This route is route #7 on Boulder 2 in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: From the Allusionist Boulder of the side with Proana and Exorexic, turn around. The face this is on is on the boulder to the right and down the hill. The closest climbable face on this boulder is the one you’re after. This route starts under the prominent ledge feature towards the top of this boulder about 6 ft left of the arete.

content.description: Climb begins on the main face of the southeastern boulder, just in front of the obvious 'death block' rock in the landing zone.
content.location: The slightly overhung face of the southeastern boulder in Death Block Area.

content.description:
Start on the large pocket above the horizontal. Move up through 2 more horizontals and top out (don’t traverse right at the second horizontal).

This route is route #3 on Boulder 1: Death Block in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: Around the corner to the left of Death block this route is on the left center of this wall. The start is the biggest pocket on this face. From another perspective, if you were on Boulder 2 of this area (the Chode face) this face would be the closest boulder climbers right.

content.description:
Start standing with hands on opposing sidepulls. Follow pockets up and right finishing by topping out just left of the arete. Be careful of the top, it can be deceptive and the landing isn't the best.

This is route #4 on Boulder 2 in the Death Block area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: On the block between the Death Block and the Allusionist Block. This route is the furthest right on the riverside face. (This face has a sickly tree growing at the top in the middle).

content.description: Sit start on two high edges (about chest height when standing). Use smeary feet to pull up to right facing sidepulls, and follow the line of sidepulls to the top, staying left of the small tree.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the block that is left of "The Allusionist". It starts just right of the talus.

content.description: Start sitting (or crouching) using prominently featured sidepulls for hands. Make a long move out right to an alright pinch, then move back left through a horizontal crack to a diagonal pinch rail. Finish by matching the jug point at the tip of the prow.
content.location: Start is on the prominent featured sidepulls a few feet to the right of the flake system that makes up the start of The Allusionist route. Prow is underneath branches of a Rhododendron.

content.description: Obvious overhung prow with very few obvious features.
content.location: The west side of the northern most boulder in the death block area. Starts on the right side of the prow through two pockets traversing up and left to the tip of the prow....have fun getting strong and figuring it out.
